data.title: Good combo deal
data.text:
The Service: Very efficient. However, not super attentive. Have to keep asking for service. 

The Food: Tasty side dishes. Love the combo meals, tofu soup with meat. Very generous meat portion, perfect to share! Very authentic Korean food. Many Korean customers there. Love their beef dishes... not so much about the chicken. 

The Parking: Private lot next to the restaurant

data.title: Disappointed Overall
data.text: My husband and I checked this place out because we love Korean BBQ.  The food and atmosphere was just OKAY for the price.  The customer service was lacking a bit.  I wouldn't want to return here...there are better places to eat KBBQ.

data.title: No Garden Spot
data.text:
We went to Young Dong Garden in Arcadia for dinner after reading a glowing review in a local Pasadena paper. It was very disappointing.  I had japchae, a yam noodle dish and bibimbap, a Korean rice dish.  Dinner started well enough with an array of small dishes, kimchi, seaweed, bean sprouts, spicy pickled zucchini and slivers of tofu marinated in sesame oil. From there the meal went downhill quickly.  The meat in the japchae had been cooked earlier as it was cold.  The dish itself was bordering on bland. The bibimbap paled in comparison to those we've had in fast food joints.  On the plus side, the dishes are big enough to share for two big eaters or even a family of four.
The service is friendly and prompt.  The atmosphere is in need of sprucing up with a paint job and perhaps some artwork. Our bill for the two dishes and one soft drink was about $30.00 before tip.  I was very much looking forward to having a good Korean restaurant in our neighborhood. Guess I will have to continue  driving to downtown Los Angeles.
There were several families dining there on what looked like ample Korean barbecue portions.

data.title: KOREAN AND AMERICAN
data.text:
This Korean restaurant is in a pleasant wood building that may have been a German restaurant previously.

The restaurant basically has two types of food: American and Korean.  By this I mean the Korean barbecue dishes are something any American can relate to because they are basically like American barbecue.

But the real Korean dishes definitely have a taste unfamiliar to Americans.  They are not like Japanese dishes.  They all seem to have the same underlying bitterness no matter what dish you order.  We had bibimbap, a bowl of meat and vegetables, which had this same taste.  We had the same dish when we were in Korea during the summer but it did not have the same bitterness there.  So be prepared for a different taste if you order a Korean dish here.

The service was good and the parking was pretty good.

data.title: good Korean restaurant
data.text: Party of 4 on a Thursday evening not crowded, service was good.We order 3 meat and tofu combos and 1 bimbibap , they gave us a lot of meat for the combos even with the tofu bowls were kind of small we still could not finish our orders . Overall the food were good and my son end up with a giant left over lunch .We had water and the total bill was $92 included 20 percent tips.

data.title: Way Better Than Last Time
data.text:
When this place first opened the staff were rude and inattentive but I'm glad to say that's changed. My Husband and I were there just last night. 
      The staff were very nice and on the ball. The food was good, if uninspired, but good.

data.title: Great Korean BBQ
data.text: Took some friends here that had never had any Asian food of any kind. They all loved the place. The BBQ short ribs are absolutely a must eat. I could not have been happier. Also the service was friendly and excellent. They brought out 6 or 7 different sides just for us to try and offered more at no charge. Loved it!

data.title: Awesome Korean food
data.text: You won't be disappointed if you like Korean. You won't leave hungry either! I had the bulgogi and kimchi. They give you as much kimchi as you can handle and the portions are large enough for two. Very tasty and a excellent choose to eat at.

data.title: Great for a gathering of hungry people!
data.text: Several restaurants have been in this location over the past 15 years I've been nearby.  This latest incarnation is the BEST.  I went recently with a group of about 16 people.  There was lots of tasty food to share.  Although I wasn't impressed by the hot tea (very bland), the food was excellent.  It felt like they kept bringing meat to our table for the all-you-can-eat table-top BBQ.  There were steamed eggs (delicious, light and fluffy), kim chi, glass noodles, pickles of various sorts... really a great luncheon.  I learned that one of the ladies in the group goes weekly with her daughter.  I will certainly be back soon.

data.title: Great food,bad customer service
data.text: I was craving Korean food so we decided to try Young Dong Garden in Arcadia,Ca. The food was great. Poor customer service. I told the our server to seperate our checks but failed to do so simply  because she cannot operate the cash register. We accepted her excuse. We went there again for dinner and it was our third time. The screwed up again.

data.title: Not to bad.
data.text: The reason we go to this restaurant not because we had good knowledge about Korean food, just want to try something different. Not to far from hotel also we notice many customer eat there when we walked pass. So that's why we want to come and try it. This is the first experience for us eating Korean food as we never before. We have no idea what kind of food to order. We really need assistant from the waiter but she was too busy serving other guests. Eventually we decided to order a meal just from the food photos are on the menu only. The food is okay but honestly it's not our taste. The service not to bad. For me It's nice to try something new but for coming back again not quite sure.

data.title: Tofu Soup - WOW
data.text: The food and service is quite good. They serve all the kimchi that you'd like to have - cabbage, zucchini, seaweed, etc. The kimchi tofu soup was the crowning glory. It was like nothing I've ever eaten before -- and it was spectacular. I live three states away but have already booked plane tickets to LA to eat at Young Dong again.

data.title: Yum!
data.text:
Young Dong is located near a Mercedes Benz Dealership and is conveniently located on Huntington Drive. The food is excellent and fresh cooked, and the service is okay with no problems. Recently went there last weekend and had a pretty good meal!

We usually go there for lunch specials or combo meals, but we also order other dishes as well. 

Ambiance: Lots of fans and air conditioning units all over the place. I think it is because it was very hot that day, and that probably the air conditioning unit that covers the whole building was broken. †he tables are stone, and each table has a button in which will signal a waiter/waitress.

The typical routine starts with a lettuce salad with a vinegar/sesame dressing, and then panchan, in which has kimchi, fish cakes, seaweed, and other dishes, as well as one vegeterian pancake with a dipping sauce.

We typically order a Combonation, in which is basically 2 dishes- one tofu and one meat course. It is a very good deal, and can save you a lot of money with big parties.  For this visit we got the beef and the beef ribs and both of them were good. The meat was juicy and tender and was very flavorful.

Tofu is good as well...they do provide a egg to cook inside. Nothing really special about it...just like your normal places, but you can also order non spicy too. 

Their Kalbi noodle soup is also very good. The meat given is flavorful unlike your usual soup extras. In addition, the soup is flavorful with lots of the beef flavor. A very good dish- and great to serve with rice.

Speaking about rice they now use black rice mixed with white rice, in which makes purple colored rice. However the black rice gives the rice more chew, and we have never seen this happen in any other restaurant other than "Red Ant Cafe" in San Gabriel.

At the end of the meal they give out some melon gum, in which is also given out in many other Korean restaurants.

Overall a pretty good restaurant!

data.title: Waitress/owner follows customer out to cuss them out because of THEIR mistake
data.text:
My 3 friends and I go to this place last night. I order Bulgogi, which is one of the MOST common dishes, and they order their dishes. 30 minutes later when my friends all have recieved their dishes I was still waiting on mine, so I ask the waitress and she says "its almost done go sit down" So I go back, I see her then serve Bulgogi to another party, that came 20 minutes after we came in. I ask again she says "its almost ready so sorry go sit down". So I sit back down. when 1 hour had passed I started getting mad because so many bulgogi's had been served and yet mine had not yet come. I ask her about it and she says the SAME thing again with an attitude. So I get mad and cancel it. She just gives me a weird look and I went back mad. Also all this time they refused to give us our ordered drinks I mean how hard is it to just give 2 cokes... also they wouldn't refill our water. 

They give us the check and I pay it to the owner angrily and the waitress comes to me and starts arguing with me shouting "I said sorry why you still mad?" I get even more mad because she's shouting at me and giving me attitude. Then she starts cussing at me in korean, and so I say some cuss words that I knew in korean back at her. She then followed me back to my car cussing at me and telling me to go die. I tell her to [-] and leave me alone before I kick her butt, so she cussed at me while she left.

Think again before coming here

data.title: Really good Korean food...
data.text: Really good Korean food!  You gotta try the Seafood Pancake!  The Galbi is excellent too!  A little pricey though.
